subject: Law
title: AI and Copyright Ownership
description: Learn AI and Copyright Ownership in one minute.

hook.text: An AI painted a portrait that sold for $432,500. Who owns the copyright‚Äîthe AI, the programmer, or nobody?

buildup.text: The US Copyright Office says only human-authored works qualify for copyright. AI-generated works don't.

discovery.text: This creates a gap: billions of AI-generated images, texts, and music have no clear copyright owner.

twist.text: If a human makes creative choices guiding the AI, those choices may create enough authorship for copyright.

climax.text: Courts worldwide are grappling with this. China has granted AI-related copyrights; the US has not.

punchline.text: AI can create. The law hasn't decided if it can own.

quiz.question: Can AI-generated works be copyrighted in the US currently?
options: Yes, the programmer always owns it
